name: Támara Hill, MS NCC CCTP LPC

episodes.title: When your family feels like a cult |Toxic Family Dynamics
episodes.description:
Sometimes family, especially toxic family, can make you feel like you are living a very psychologically and emotionally overwhelming trap. 

Feeling trapped in a situation where you have no self-expression, no freedom from the enemy, and you feel misunderstood can lead to years of complex trauma and fear of abandonment. 

In this video, I discuss the psychology of the toxic family dynamic that resembles the behaviors of a cult.

---------------------------------------------------------------------
#trauma #TOXICFAMILY
#tamarahilllpc
--------------------------------------------------------------------
DISCUSSED IN THIS VIDEO:
0:00 intro
AUTHORITARIAN LEADERSHHIP
patterns of distrust 
FAMILY DYSFUNCTION
objectification of who you are
LOVEING DISTANCE theory 
ELEMENTS OF A CULT-LIKE FAMILY
elements of a true cult
POSSIBLE IMPACT ON YOU

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Mentioned In The Video:
1. Mattejat F, Remschmidt H. The children of mentally ill parents. Dtsch Arztebl Int. 2008 Jun;105(23):413-8. doi: 10.3238/arztebl.2008.0413. Epub 2008 Jun 6. PMID: 19626164; PMCID: PMC2696847.

2. Milyavsky M, Kruglanski AW, Chernikova M, Schori-Eyal N. Evidence for arrogance: On the relative importance of expertise, outcome, and manner. PLoS One. 2017 Jul 6;12(7):e0180420. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0180420. PMID: 28683114; PMCID: PMC5500344.

3. Sell M, Daubmann A, Zapf H, Adema B, Busmann M, Stiawa M, Winter SM, Lambert M, Wegscheider K, Wiegand-Grefe S. Family Functioning in Families Affected by Parental Mental Illness: Parent, Child, and Clinician Ratings. Int J Environ Res Public Health. 2021 Jul 28;18(15):7985. doi: 10.3390/ijerph18157985. PMID: 34360277; PMCID: PMC8345719.

episodes.title: Dangers Of A Cult Mentality: How It Can Ruin Your Life | Toxic Family Issues
episodes.description:
Cults are small groups of people (sometimes even toxic family members) who have a common belief system, feel interconnected or "close," and may believe in the same principles, religion, or cultural morays, who strives to control and manipulate your mind. 

Toxic family members may have a "cult-like" mentality and a series of behaviors that can make you feel overpowered, undermined, and abused. 

Having a "cult-like" mindset can lead to codependency, traumatic bonding, and intense fear of independence. 

In this video, I discuss the psychology of family, religious, and spiritual cults and how they negatively impact your adult relationships and mind over time.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#trauma #TOXICFAMILY
#tamarahilllpc
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
DISCUSSED IN THIS VIDEO:
0:00 intro
2:12 cult leaders 101
3:00 behaviors of cult leaders and what they do
5:00 submissiveness 
7:00 WHAT HAPPENS TO YOU
9:00 HOW CULT LEADERS TAKE OVER YOUR MIND
15:05 Cognitive Theory (thoughts, feelings, behaviors)

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Mentioned In The Video:
1.Festinger, L. Reicken, H.W., & Schachter, S. (1956, reprinted 2011). When Prophecy Fails. Blacksburg, VA: Wilder Publications.

2. Sharps, M.J., Liao, S.W., & Herrera, M.R. (2013). It's the End of the World, and They Don't Feel Fine; The Psychology of December 21, 2012. Skeptical Inquirer, 37, 34-39.

3. Psychology of cults https://online.utpb.edu/about-us/articles/psychology/the-psychology-of-cults/.

episodes.title: Traumatic Religion: "What Is A Cult & How Does It Work?" - Psychotherapy Crash Course
episodes.description:
What do you know about satanic ritual abuse?

Have you ever heard of it?

In this video, I explore the topic (only touching the surface) and explain a few signs you may be in a dangerous and traumatic religious cult.

There is also often a strong correlation of suicide to dangerous and traumatic religious cults. In fact, research suggests that suicide-contagion may be associated with a cult-like mindset. 

In 1974 a religious sect group was formed by Marshall Applewhite and Bonnie Nettles. Heaven's Gate was a religious cult based out of San Diego, California and included about 39 members. The group's "mission" was to identify UFO's and engage in extreme self-reunification which resulted in castration. The group existed under a variety of names over the years as if it wanted to hide and escape ever being truly found out. The only notoriety the group received was after the 39 members committed suicide in a suburban area of San Diego in March of 1997. News reports and studies that include the history of this
group report that both Applewhite and Nettles believed they were the
witnesses mentioned in the book of Revelations (Revelations chapter 11)
in the Bible. 

Scary case! To read further on this story get my book (in the video).


I welcome your comments, questions, and experiences.



Helpful resources:
1. Neurobiology of trauma https://reachcounseling.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Neurobiology-of-the-Brain-Casey-Hanson-Ph.D-LPc-MSCP.pdf

2. Traumatic bonding https://blogs.psychcentral.com/caregivers/2015/09/9-signs-of-traumatic-bonding-bonded-to-the-abuser/

3. Trauma Counseling https://www.betterhelp.com/advice/trauma/what-is-trauma-therapy-and-how-does-it-work/

4. Journaling https://psychcentral.com/lib/the-healing-power-of-writing-a-therapists-guide-to-using-journaling-with-clients/

5. Healing from trauma https://youtu.be/3QziN-ftYtk


Learn what this 4-week series is all about: 
https://youtu.be/bdv-S3FN4f4
